article.headline: Campbell 87, Radford 70
article.story: BUIES CREEK, N.C. (AP) -- Reggie Bishop scored a season-high 23 points to lead Campbell past Radford 87-70 on Saturday. Jonathan Rodriguez had 22 points -- one shy of his career high- and added 10 rebounds to help the Camels (2-3) snap a three-game losing streak. Martell McDuffy led Radford (1-5) with 20 points and Joey Lynch-Flohr added 13 before fouling out with 4:46 left. The Highlanders led by nine in the first half before fading. Freshman Jose Cami added 12 points for Campbell, which overcame 27 turnovers, had a season-high point total and made more free throws (24) than Radford attempted (21). Cami's 3-pointer at the first-half buzzer gave the Camels a 37-36 lead and they would never trail again. Campbell also shot a season-best 52 percent.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
